source_request: Review proposed Railway reliability fixes and create an implementation plan.
constraints: integrations.md is status: partial, so per policy each step confidence is capped at 6/10
no unresolved context gaps are currently logged

review_findings.summary: Public port fallback still defaults to 3000 while container EXPOSE is 8080.
review_findings.impact: If PORT is missing/misrouted, wrapper can bind 3000 while expected routing targets 8080, increasing 502 risk.
review_findings.recommendation: Change fallback from 3000 to 8080 and keep startup port logging.

review_findings.impact: Primary work is docs/consistency, not new endpoint creation.
review_findings.recommendation: Keep /setup/healthz for deploy checks and document /healthz as the public live-debug endpoint.

review_findings.summary: Interactive OAuth remains selectable and is not hard-blocked server-side.
review_findings.impact: Headless Railway onboarding can fail or stall when interactive auth choices are submitted.
review_findings.recommendation: Add server-side rejection for interactive choices in non-TTY/headless environments, and disable setup run button in UI for those choices.

review_findings.summary: Persistent /data/bin path is not included, which makes binary-based skills harder on Railway.
review_findings.impact: Users can install tools under /data but executables may not resolve by default.
review_findings.recommendation: Include /data/bin in PATH and document bootstrap installation flow for binaries.

review_findings.summary: Build-memory resilience is documented but not enforced via Node heap setting.
review_findings.impact: Builds on lower-memory Railway plans remain vulnerable to heap OOM.
review_findings.recommendation: Add NODE_OPTIONS memory cap guidance (and optionally BuildKit cache guidance) with explicit caveats.

review_findings.summary: Debug endpoint already has substantial diagnostics but can better classify Discord 'offline' causes.
review_findings.impact: Operators still need manual interpretation for common token/config failures.
review_findings.recommendation: Add explicit readiness hints and channel-specific issue summaries to /setup/api/debug response.

steps.step: Step 1 - Align port fallback and runtime messaging
steps.description: Update public port fallback to 8080 and preserve explicit startup logs.
changes: Set fallback in PORT resolution from "3000" to "8080".
validation: Review startup logs for expected bound port.
Manual smoke: deploy with and without explicit PORT override in non-Railway test env.
steps.risk: Changing default can affect non-Railway local assumptions.
steps.mitigation: Keep OPENCLAW_PUBLIC_PORT override support and document explicit local PORT usage.
steps.rationale: Change is localized and low complexity; behavior impact is predictable.

steps.step: Step 2 - Health-check semantics and docs alignment
steps.description: Keep /setup/healthz for deploy checks and document /healthz as the preferred public liveness/debug endpoint.
changes: Retain railway deploy healthcheck path unless operational testing suggests otherwise.
Update README troubleshooting and support sections to emphasize /healthz payload usage.
validation: Confirm both /setup/healthz and /healthz return 200 in deployed service.
steps.risk: Operator confusion if endpoint roles are not clearly differentiated.
steps.mitigation: Document endpoint purpose with clear one-line descriptions.
steps.rationale: Endpoint already exists; mostly documentation consistency work.

steps.step: Step 3 - Enforce non-interactive auth choices on Railway/headless
steps.description: Prevent interactive OAuth flows in environments without a usable TTY.
changes: Add server-side interactive auth-choice classifier and reject unsupported choices with HTTP 400.
Detect headless context using TTY checks and/or Railway env hints.
In setup UI, show warning text and disable Run button for blocked interactive choices.
validation: Try submitting known interactive choices; verify deterministic rejection message.
Try API-key choices; verify setup path remains unaffected.
steps.risk: Over-broad classifier could block valid non-interactive auth choices.
steps.mitigation: Use explicit allow/block lists derived from known AUTH_GROUP option values and add unit-level tests for classifier behavior.
steps.rationale: Behavioral logic touches both frontend and backend; auth choice taxonomy can drift.

steps.step: Step 4 - Make Railway binary installs first-class via /data/bin
steps.description: Add /data/bin to execution PATH and provide Railway-native skills guidance.
changes: Prepend /data/bin to PATH in runtime image.
Ensure subprocess env PATH includes /data/bin for wrapper-spawned commands.
Add README section: Skills on Railway (works well vs needs binaries) plus bootstrap.sh binary install example.
validation: Place test executable in /data/bin and verify wrapper commands can resolve it.
Confirm docs accurately reflect runtime image tool availability.
steps.risk: PATH precedence could shadow system binaries if names collide.
steps.mitigation: Prepend only /data/bin and keep existing system PATH; document collision caveat.
steps.rationale: Straightforward, but PATH ordering side effects require careful review.

steps.description: Reduce OOM risk with Node heap cap and add cache guidance for builds.
changes: Add NODE_OPTIONS default with conservative max-old-space-size value.
Document memory override recommendations for constrained Railway tiers.
Document optional BuildKit cache approach; gate implementation on Railway builder support.
validation: Build image on constrained environment and compare OOM incidence.
Verify no regression in successful build timings on normal tier.
steps.risk: Heap cap can under-allocate and fail large builds.
steps.mitigation: Document override path and keep value configurable via Railway Variables.
steps.rationale: Runtime/build memory behavior varies by Railway plan and builder capabilities.

steps.description: Expose clearer cause indicators and quick triage output in /setup/api/debug.
changes: Add explicit status flags for channel env/token presence (redacted, boolean only).
Include gateway reachability probe result and concise likely-cause hints.
Surface debug summary in setup UI and README troubleshooting flow.
validation: Simulate missing Discord token and verify API emits explicit missing-token hint.
Simulate invalid token config and verify hint differs from missing-token case.
steps.risk: Diagnostic hints can become stale if upstream OpenClaw output changes.
steps.mitigation: Base hints on stable signals (exit code, token presence booleans, gateway connectivity) instead of brittle log text parsing.
steps.rationale: Existing debug surface reduces complexity, but robust error classification needs careful heuristics.

steps.step: Step 7 - Verification, audit logging, and rollout
steps.description: Complete documentation/audit updates and run manual validation checklist before merge.
changes: Record Baby Steps checkpoints and review outcomes.
Capture post-implementation reflection and durable learnings.
Update progress with completion status and any deferred items.
validation: Confirm audit entries exist for each increment.
Confirm Memory Bank files reflect final state.
steps.risk: Operational steps skipped under time pressure.
steps.mitigation: Use a fixed completion checklist and block merge until checklist is complete.
steps.rationale: Process-heavy but deterministic once checklist is defined.

risks.description: Interactive auth blocklist may drift as OpenClaw auth options evolve.
risks.mitigation: Centralize auth-choice metadata and assert allowed/blocked behavior in tests.

risks.description: Port fallback alignment may be misconstrued as replacing Railway-injected PORT behavior.
risks.mitigation: Keep comments explicit: Railway PORT remains primary; fallback is safety net.

risks.description: Build-memory tuning may not fit all workloads.
risks.mitigation: Document NODE_OPTIONS as configurable and provide recommended ranges.

rollback_strategy: Revert port fallback/default PATH changes if deploy routing or command resolution regressions appear.
Gate interactive-auth rejection behind a feature flag if onboarding false-positives are reported.
Remove NODE_OPTIONS default if build failures increase on larger refs.

overall_confidence.rationale: Plan is grounded in current codebase, but integrations context is partial and automated reviewer execution is currently blocked (GAP-20260221-001).
